results.title: Jungle Fighters at Canungra School
results.brief_description: Forty miles south-west of Brisbane, at Canungra, troops of the 2nd Battalion are being turned into skilled jungle fighters. After an initial toughening course, training is done on a course consisting of obstacles the soldier could normally expect to find in jungle warfare. As the jungle affords many hiding places for the enemy, a course in snap-shooting is given. Training also includes detection of booby traps and trip wires, security precautions, sneaking, ability to gain information from objects left by the enemy indicating his path, position and strength, learning to take advantages of trees, tree climbing and assault training.

results.title: Jungle bunny [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Fotini Manikakis and Zok Nyste
results.brief_description: With the phrase “I’ll take that one”, African tribesman Mbuti Matabuiki Lobiko finds himself sharing a household with Australian housewife Clarissa Penfold and her family. A humorous fable that looks at the way we exploit each other both consciously and unconsciously, across all levels of our relationships - cultural, national, racial, sexual and personal. Cast includes Renny Augustine, Genevieve Mooy and Neil Fitzpatrick.

results.title: Jungle book
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Alexander Korda and Zoltan Korda
results.brief_description: A young boy returns to his native village attempting to adapt to human customs and his adopted family. The discovery of a coin in the jungle awakens the greed of the village people who hope to discover a legendary buried treasure. Disillusioned by the greed and violence of humanity he retreats to his loyal and trusted friends…the beasts of the jungle. Stars Sabu. Based on “Jungle book” by Rudyard Kipling.

results.title: Jungle & sea of grasses (compilation)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Andrew Neal and Richard Mattheus
results.brief_description: Presents the ecology of jungles, savanna grasslands and deserts. Teachers advised to view in advance so that segments may be identified as appropriate to concentration spans. Narrated by David Attemborough

results.title: Jungfrukallan = The Virgin Spring
results.brief_description: Bergman won his first Academy Award for this brooding medieval tale based in an old Swedish ballad, closely comparable with the ‘Seventh seal’, examining the conflict between Christianity and pagnism rife throughout the Middle Ages. Set in beautiful 14th Century Sweden, it is the sombre, powerful fable of peasant parents (Max Von Sydow and Birgitta Valberg) whose daughter, a young virgin is brutally raped and murdered by swineherds after her half sister has invoked a pagan curse. By a bizarre twist of fate the murderers ask for food and shelter from the dead girl’s parents, who, discovering the truth about their lodgers, exact a chilling revenge. A cruel and sensational allegory, a tale of superstition, religious fervour, muurder and revenge, the formal simplicity and overt symbolism conspire to create an extraordinary metaphysical charge, aided by the the luminous, haunting black and white photography and Bergman’s meticulous direction.

results.title: Jumpy, the grasshopper
results.brief_description: Jumpy tells a story about a grasshopper and other insects as a basis for language/arts activities, and to enrich the study of insects. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Jumping the gun
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Murray Fahey and Jane Schneider
results.brief_description: Combining style from film noir, TV advertising imagery, Mills and Boon romance and Sydney ghetto realism, this is a farcical look at how one woman’s “morning after” fantasy turns into a tragi-comic nightmare.

results.title: Jumping for Joy
results.creator_credit: Thames and Clyde Film Company, Educational Films of Scotland and Stanley Russell
results.brief_description: An introduction to trampolining. A semi-instructional film, it shows the growing popularity of the five basic landing positions, and shows suitable exercises for people of different ages. A section on the value of trampolining in rehabilitation work is also included.

results.title: Jumpin' Jack Flash (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lawrence Gordon, Joel Silver and Penny Marshall
results.brief_description: Whoopi Goldberg stars in this action adventure comedy hit. There’s music, murder, mayhem and a lot of laughs as she tries to save an endangered spy operative, code-named Jack - even though she’s never met him! Now the CIA and the KGB have her jumpin’ and the world may never be the same.
